Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Hogarth's diary mentions 9 arrows from Ankhef's tomb (Tomb 9) with flint tips like 9 of these. Tomb 11 also produced 'fragments of arrows' according to Hogarth's object register.
See Taylor, Death and the Afterlife, 109.
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (I, 172 n.1145)
Cartwright and Taylor 2008 / Wooden Egyptian archery bows in the collections of the British Museum (p.78, fig.1, p.79, table.1, p.81)
